usefulItems: airtight container, cling wrap, parchment paper, rolling pin, wire rack, baking sheets (approx. 16 in. x 14 in.), cookie cutter (2 in.), refrigerator, oven
title: Orange Currant Cookies

ingredients.content: 1 orange, organic, thin peel only, no pith, plus 1 tbsp juice
7 oz all-purpose flour, plus extra for dust
5 oz unsalted butter, very cold, cut into pieces

preparations.content: Place sugar and orange peel into mixing bowl and zest <b>10 sec/speed 10<b>. Scrape down sides and base of mixing bowl with spatula and zest a further <b>5 sec/speed 8<b>.
Add flour and butter and mix <b>Turbo/1 sec/4 times<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add currants, egg yolk and orange juice and mix <b>8 sec//speed 4<b>. Tip dough out and bring together into a ball. Wrap in cling wrap and chill in refrigerator for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 350°F and line two baking sheets with parchment paper.

Divide chilled dough in half and roll each piece out on a lightly floured surface to ⅛ in. thickness. Cut out rounds using a fluted cookie cutter (2½ in.) and transfer to baking sheets. Reroll the trimmings and repeat until all dough is used.
Bake 10-15 minutes (350°F) until lightly golden. Allow to rest on baking sheets for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. Serve or store in an airtight container.
